# Loop over input items and add a new field called 'myNewField' to the JSON of each one
import json
convert = json.loads(_items[0]["json"]["body"]["snapshot"])
return convert

# Loop over input items and add a new field called 'myNewField' to the JSON of each one
from datetime import datetime, timedelta
seven_days_ago = datetime.now() - timedelta(days=7)
games = []
for item in _items:
  game = {}
  time = datetime.strptime(item["json"]["effectiveDate"], "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ")
  if time < datetime.now() and seven_days_ago < time:
    game["title"] = item["json"]["title"]
    game["effectiveDate"] = item["json"]["effectiveDate"]
    
    startDate = item["json"]["promotions"]["promotionalOffers"][0]["promotionalOffers"][0]["startDate"]
    endDate = item["json"]["promotions"]["promotionalOffers"][0]["promotionalOffers"][0]["endDate"]
    
    dt_startDate = datetime.strptime(startDate, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ")
    dt_endDate = datetime.strptime(endDate, "%Y-%m-%dT%H:%M:%S.%fZ")
    game["startDate"] = dt_startDate.strftime("%B %d at %H:%M:%S")
    game["endDate"] = dt_endDate.strftime("%B %d at %H:%M:%S")
    
    game["image"] = item["json"]["keyImages"][1]["url"]
    games.append(game)
return games

# Loop over input items and add a new field called 'myNewField' to the JSON of each one
import re
import json
from typing import List, Dict, Optional

def parse_steam_games(text: str) -> List[Dict]:
    """
    Parse Steam games data from raw text format
    """
    # Regex pour sÃ©parer les Ã©lÃ©ments (lookahead positif)
    separator_pattern = r'(?=\[https://shared\.(?:cloudflare|akamai)\.steamstatic\.com/store_item_assets/steam/apps/)'
    
    # SÃ©parer les Ã©lÃ©ments
    elements = re.split(separator_pattern, text)
    elements = [elem.strip() for elem in elements if elem.strip()]
    
    games = []
    
    for element in elements:
        game_data = parse_single_game(element)
        if game_data:
            games.append(game_data)
    
    return games

def parse_single_game(element: str) -> Optional[Dict]:
    """
    Parse a single game element
    """
    lines = [line.strip() for line in element.split('\n') if line.strip()]
    
    if len(lines) < 4:
        return None
    
    try:
        game = {}
        
        # Extract image URL et app ID
        image_url_match = re.search(r'\[https://shared\.(?:cloudflare|akamai)\.steamstatic\.com/store_item_assets/steam/apps/(\d+)/([^\]]+)\]', lines[0])
        if image_url_match:
            game['app_id'] = int(image_url_match.group(1))
            game['image_url'] = lines[0].strip('[]')
        
        # Title (ligne aprÃ¨s l'URL de l'image)
        game['title'] = lines[1] if len(lines) > 1 else ""
        
        # Date (ligne aprÃ¨s le titre)
        game['date'] = lines[2] if len(lines) > 2 else ""
        
        # Parse discount, prices, and store URL
        prices = []
        discount = None
        store_url = None
        
        for line in lines[3:]:
            # Discount percentage
            if re.match(r'-?\d+%', line):
                discount = line
            # Price (format XX,XXâ‚¬)
            elif re.match(r'\d+,\d+â‚¬', line):
                prices.append(line)
            # Store URL
            elif 'store.steampowered.com' in line:
                store_url = line.strip('[]')
        
        game['discount'] = discount
        game['original_price'] = prices[0] if len(prices) > 1 else None
        game['current_price'] = prices[-1] if prices else None
        game['store_url'] = store_url
        
        # Calculer si c'est gratuit
        game['is_free'] = game['current_price'] == '0,00â‚¬'
        
        return game
        
    except Exception as e:
        print(f"Erreur lors du parsing: {e}")
        return None


games = parse_steam_games(_('Get Search Result')[0]["json"]["search_result"])

return games

# Loop over input items and add a new field called 'my_new_field' to the JSON of each one
for item in _items:
  item["json"]["text"] = item["json"].get("body", {}).get("diff", None)
return _items

    game["endDate"] = dt_endDate.strftime("%B %d at %H:%M:%S")
    
    game["image"] = item["json"]["keyImages"][1]["url"]
    games.append(game)
return games
